channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2023090232
item.description:
Report E-2023090232

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 6, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing UN1805 was damaged due to falling off the lift gate and released approximately eighty (80) gallons of product to the soil. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed poly sheeting around the impacted areas and patched the one (1) damaged tote. The crew returned the next day to perform a tote transfer. SET personnel conducted a gravity transfer of the remaining material from the damaged tote into one (1) new 330-gallon tote provided by on-site management. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. Once neutralized, SET personnel utilized a back hoe to remove the impacted soil. The excavated area was backfilled with clean soil, graded to match pre-existing topography, and covered with erosion matting to promote vegetative growth. All impacted soil was collected and containerized into one (1) roll off and staged on-site pending waste profiling for disposal purposes. One (1) background and one (1) confirmation sample were obtained from the site, placed into laboratory approved containers, and transported under chain of custody protocol to the laboratory.

item.title: Report X-2023081114
item.description:
Report X-2023081114

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: LAKE ORION
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While traveling down the non-conveyable belt the package somehow ended up on its side. One bottle with the loose cap leaked but the spillage was absorbed by the box and nothing was released. The bottle that leaked was the TISAB I, which does not appear to be a hazmat. The Sulfuric Acid that is a hazmat does not appear to have leaked. DescribePack: The bottle of TISAB I had a slightly loose cap so it did not have a complete seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box absorbed the release. The box was immediately put into a hazmat bin in order to separate it from all other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023081101
item.description:
Report X-2023081101

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was found leaking. Upon investigation, the lid of the container was loose and bent resulting in a spill. DescribePack: Loose Lid/Cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: This package was placed in a tote and bag to contain the spill.

item.title: Report X-2023081098
item.description:
Report X-2023081098

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED WET AND RIPPING BOX WAS FOUND DURING THE LOADING PROCESS, PUT IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND BROUGHT OVER FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT AND HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: JUG WAS LEAKING FROM THE SEAM UNDER THE HANDLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS TURNED RIGHT SIDE UP
